name: Legal Specialist - Contracts

conditional: Training sessions (if applies to current work)
always_decline: Non-legal meetings without clear legal need

requires_prep: Contract negotiations (45-60 min: review terms, research precedents, prepare positions)
Compliance reviews (30-45 min: review regulations, assess risk, prepare guidance)
Executive consultations (30 min: research issue, identify risks, prepare options)
optional_prep: Internal consultations (15 min: review background if complex)
Vendor meetings (20 min: review agreement history)
Team meetings (10 min: review agenda if substantive)

work_style: Legal Specialist - Contracts: Focused on contract reviews and compliance with 3-4 years experience. Spends 8-12 hours/week in meetings, primarily contract reviews and legal consultations. Work is deadline-driven (contract signatures, compliance deadlines) but generally planned with advance notice. Values clear meeting agendas and legal context - avoids meetings without defined legal need. Balances transactional work (contract reviews) with advisory work (legal consultations). Comfortable working independently with periodic team check-ins. Known for thorough contract reviews and pragmatic risk assessment.
career_stage: 3-4 years into legal career, developing specialized expertise in commercial contracts. Building reputation as reliable contract reviewer. Career growth depends on: (1) Handling complex enterprise deals, (2) Building business relationships, (3) Developing specialized knowledge. Success metric: Complete contract reviews within SLA, no major contract issues escalating. Risk: Becoming bottleneck for deals. Opportunity: Handle strategic enterprise contracts, expand to new legal areas (IP, privacy).
stress_level: ⭐⭐ LOW-MODERATE: 8-12 hour meeting weeks, work is important but rarely urgent emergencies. Deadlines are known in advance. Missing meeting = delayed review but can usually reschedule. Lower stakes than sales or executive roles. Comfortable environment for alpha testing - can tolerate 70-75% accuracy without major risk.
notes: KEY INSIGHT: Legal specialists are Tier 3 because stakes are lower - missing meeting = delayed review but not lost deal or career risk. Work is deadline-driven but predictable. Perfect for alpha testing - low risk if tool makes mistakes, can provide valuable feedback for improvement.
